summary: Ronald Adrine was a staff member of the Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). He is identified as Staff Counsel with an annual salary of $27,000.00. His name appears in several payroll reports and certification reports related to the HSCA's staff, covering the period from November 1978 to March 1979. A document from the Assassination Records Review Board mentions the postponed release of his Social Security number from the HSCA staff payroll records.
significance: Ronald Adrine's significance lies in his role as Staff Counsel for the HSCA, a committee tasked with investigating the assassination of President John F. Kennedy. His presence in payroll records and related documentation provides insight into the staffing and operations of the HSCA during its investigation.
